definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: As a result, he had become the soul of caution.
sentences.chinese: 结果，他就变得胆小如鼠。

sentences.english: His cowardice in face of the enemy was contemptible 7.
sentences.chinese: 他在敌人面前胆小如鼠，真是可鄙。

sentences.english: The boy is as timid as a rabbit.
After all, Europe is rich but wimpy.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，欧洲虽富有但却胆小如鼠。

sentences.english: He remained a mouse in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 在公众事务上他依然胆小如鼠。

sentences.english: Care must be taken in using this method lest overflow should occur.
sentences.chinese: 在使用此法时要胆小如鼠，以免会发生溢流现象。

sentences.english: It's gone. You're building a rat ship here, a vessel for seagoing snitches.
sentences.chinese: 现在博德培养的是一群胆小如鼠，卖友求荣的家伙。

sentences.english: She despised him for his cowardice.
sentences.chinese: 她因他胆小如鼠而鄙视他。

sentences.english: You could say that the cowardly lion was "chicken-hearted."
sentences.chinese: 你可以说这头狮子“胆小如鼠。”

definition: greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
lit. show strength while weak inside (idiom); appearing fierce while cowardly at heart/a sheep in wolf's clothing
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
lit. the fox exploits the tiger's might (idiom); fig. to use powerful connections to intimidate people
fearing nothing in Heaven or Earth (idiom)/fearless
pinyin: tian1 bu4 pa4 di4 bu4 pa4
